times.We can know that the main photocatalytic reduction products are CO and CH (Fig. 6).MIL-68(In) had the lowest CO and CH 4 production rates of 24.95 molgh and 11.67 molgh, respectively.The yields of CO and CH 4 on C-In 2 O 3 are 3.04 and 4.77 times that of MIL-68 (In), respectively.We also used In 2 O 3 for photocatalytic reaction to compare with the photocatalytic performance of C-In 2 O 3 (Fig. S5).It can be seen that the performance of C-In 2 O 3 is better, which may be because the doping of C

performance of the material is determined by the electron-hole transfer and separation efficiency as well as the optical capture ability 63.Therefore, we used photocurrent and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) response to verify the electron-hole separation, recombination, and transfer rates of all catalysts.The photocurrent intensity of the prepared sample was investigated during the alternating cycle of visible light irradiation and dark environment, and its photocurrent curve over time is

to obtain C-In 2 O 3 g-C 3 N 4 heterojunction.The unique hollow tubular structure, carbon doping and type-II heterojunction of C-In 2 O 3 g-C 3 N 4 expand the light absorption capacity and promote the separation of photogenerated electron-hole pairs, thus significantly improve the activity of photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 .Among them, C-In 2 O 3 g-C 3 N 4 -5 shows the highest CO 2 reduction activity towards CO (153.42 molgh) and CH 4 (110.31molgh).
